snippet: The card, called Amex EveryDay and highlighted in an ad campaign starring Tina Fey, is aimed at women the company sees as a key to growth.
abstract: American Express, best known for its premium charge cards that offer lucrative travel, retail and entertainment rewards, but come with high annual fees, is introducing no-fee rewards credit card; marketing for new card, called Amex EveryDay, is aimed at capturing everyday women, consumers who are not big spenders, which has long eluded company but is seen as key to growth.
lead_paragraph: The card, called Amex EveryDay and highlighted in an ad campaign starring Tina Fey, is aimed at women the company sees as a key to growth.

headline.main: With New Rewards Card, Amex Focuses on Busy-Mom Market
headline.print_headline: With New Rewards Card, Amex Focuses on Busy-Mom Market
